security_audit.summary: This is a documentation-only skill containing writing guidelines for technical documentation. No executable code, network calls, file system access, or environment variables are present. The skill is purely instructional content.

content.value_statement: Transform scattered technical information into clear, structured documentation that teams can actually use. This skill provides proven writing frameworks that make technical content accessible and maintainable.
actual_capabilities: Applies pyramid writing structure with conclusions first
Creates documentation following established writing baselines
Formats content using Markdown with proper heading hierarchy
Maintains factual accuracy without adding assumptions
Structures SOP documents with task-oriented formatting
Implements consistent citation and referencing standards
limitations: Only provides writing guidelines, not automated formatting
Requires manual implementation of documentation standards
Focused on Chinese language documentation practices
Does not generate actual documentation content automatically

use_cases.title: Standardize team documentation
use_cases.description: Establish consistent writing standards across your technical team to improve documentation quality and readability.

use_cases.title: Write better API documentation
use_cases.description: Create clear, concise API docs that follow industry best practices and help users integrate quickly.

use_cases.title: Improve knowledge sharing
use_cases.description: Implement documentation guidelines that ensure critical technical knowledge is properly captured and shared.

prompt_templates.title: Basic Documentation
prompt_templates.prompt: Help me write documentation for our REST API endpoint. Use the tech-doc guidelines to create a clear, structured guide that developers can follow.

prompt_templates.title: SOP Creation
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a standard operating procedure for deploying our microservices using the tech-doc formatting standards. Include prerequisites, steps, and common errors.

prompt_templates.title: Technical Explanation
prompt_templates.prompt: Write a technical explanation of our event-driven architecture following the tech-doc guidelines. Start with a conclusion, then provide supporting details.

prompt_templates.title: Advanced Documentation
prompt_templates.prompt: Develop comprehensive documentation for our data pipeline that includes introduction, architecture overview, deployment guide, and troubleshooting sections using tech-doc standards.

output_examples.input: Document our new authentication API endpoint
output: The authentication API validates user credentials and returns JWT tokens for authorized access.
POST /api/auth/login with username and password to receive a JWT token.

best_practices: Always start with a clear conclusion before explaining details
Use consistent terminology throughout all documentation
Include practical examples that users can copy and execute
anti_patterns: Writing long paragraphs without clear structure or headings
Adding assumptions or information not present in source material
Using passive voice or overly complex sentence structures

faq.question: Is this skill compatible with English documentation?
faq.answer: Yes, while the guidelines are in Chinese, the principles apply to any language. The structural recommendations work universally.

faq.question: What are the limits of this skill?
faq.answer: This skill provides writing guidelines only. It doesn't automatically format or generate documentation content.

faq.question: Can I integrate this with my existing documentation tools?
faq.answer: The guidelines can be applied in any documentation platform that supports Markdown, including GitHub, Confluence, and static site generators.

faq.question: How does this ensure data safety?
faq.answer: This is a guideline-only skill with no code execution or data access. It simply provides writing standards for creating documentation.

faq.question: What if my team has different writing preferences?
faq.answer: Use these guidelines as a baseline and adapt specific rules to match your team's style while maintaining core structural principles.

faq.question: How does this compare to other documentation tools?
faq.answer: Unlike automated tools, this focuses on writing quality and structure principles that improve readability and maintainability of technical content.
